description.en: Indicates how the device is designed to be placed.
Nominal sensible capacity. Usually measured in Watts (W, J/s).
Minimum allowable air flow rate. Usually measured in m3/s.
Maximum allowable air flow rate. Usually measured in m3/s.
Allowable operation ambient (air, fluid) temperature range. Usually measured in degrees Kelvin (K).
Nominal latent capacity. Usually measured in Watts (W, J/s).
Allowable operation ambient (air, fluid) temperature range. Usually measured in degrees Kelvin (K).

A coil is a device used to provide heat transfer between non-mixing media. A common example is a cooling coil, which utilizes a finned coil in which circulates chilled water, antifreeze, or refrigerant that is used to remove heat from air moving across the surface of the coil. A coil may be used either for heating or cooling purposes by placing a series of tubes (the coil) carrying a heating or cooling fluid into an airstream. The coil may be constructed from tubes bundled in a serpentine form or from finne
